Yes, Chile has taken several actions to address its plastic waste problem in recent years. Here are some notable examples:

1. Ban on single-use plastic bags: In 2018, Chile became the first country in Latin America to ban single-use plastic bags in all coastal cities. The ban expanded to include all cities in the country in 2020. This has helped reduce plastic waste and encourage the use of reusable bags.

2. Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR): Chile has implemented EPR policies for various products, including packaging and electronics, which make producers responsible for managing the waste generated by their products. This encourages producers to design products that are easier to recycle and reduces waste.

3. National Plastics Pact: In 2020, Chile launched the National Plastics Pact, which aims to reduce plastic waste and promote a circular economy. The pact brings together over 80 companies, NGOs, and government agencies to reduce plastic use, promote recycling, and improve waste management practices.

4. Plastic bottle recycling: Chile has implemented a successful recycling program for plastic bottles, which includes a deposit system for returning bottles. The system has resulted in high recycling rates and has helped reduce plastic pollution.

These initiatives demonstrate Chile's commitment to addressing its plastic waste problem and promoting sustainable development. By implementing policies and programs to reduce plastic waste, Chile is taking important steps to protect its environment and promote a circular economy.
